intro: Becium neumannii, commonly known as the Neumann's becium, is a flowering plant native to the Cape Province of South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
